page.title: 07RATHO SCHOOL
page.content: PRIOR TO 1982 RATHO PRIMARY SCHOOL WAS SITUATED IN A VICTORIAN BUILDING. IN MARCH 1983 THE NEW PRIMARY SCHOOL WAS OPENED BY COUNCILLER GILCHRIST. THE NEW SCHOOL IS A SEMI OPEN PLAN TYPE AND HAS A ROLE OF ABOUT 190 PUPILS AND EIGHT TEACHERS. THE SCHOOL HAS THE DISTINCTION OF BEING THE FIRST LOTHIAN REGION PRIMARY SCHOOL TO HAVE COST OVER ONE MILLION POUNDS. WHEN PUPILS LEAVE RATHO PRIMARY SCHOOL THEY ATTEND BALERNO HIGH SCHOOL. THIS SCHOOL IS SOME DISTANCE AWAY AND THEREFORE THE PUPILS HAVE TO BE BUSSED. MOST PUPILS AT HIGH SCHOOL DO NOT MIND THE JOURNEY BUT THEY FEEL THAT IT MAKES THE SCHOOL DAY MUCH LONGER. ATTACHED TO THE PRIMARY SCHOOL IS THE COMMUNITY CENTRE WHICH HAS A COFFEE BAR,PLAY GROUP,YOUTH CLUB, BADMINTON AND MANY OTHER FACILITIES.
